org.prop4j

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.prop4j.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    And, AtLeast, AtMost, Choose, Equals, Implies, Literal, Not, Or

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A propositional node that can be transformed into conjunctive normal form (cnf).
    Author:
    Thomas Thuem, Marcus Pinnecke (Feature Interface)

      • getValue

        public abstract boolean getValue(java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean> assignment)

        Returns true iff this node evaluates to true under the given truth value assignment. The result of the evaluation is the same as if each positive literal in the expression were replaced by the corresponding boolean value in the given map.

        For example, for the conjunction operation, this operations returns true iff the following formula is satisfied: 
        c1
 ∧ … ∧ cn
        Where ci is the i-th of the n children of the node.
        Parameters:
        assignment - truth value assignment from variable to true or false
        Returns:
        the result of evaluation of this node

      • isConjunctiveNormalForm

        public abstract boolean isConjunctiveNormalForm()
        Returns true iff this is in conjunctive normal form. This is the case iff this is a conjunction of disjunctions of literals. Note that redundant nodes may be omitted. This means that instead of one-literal conjunctions and disjunctions, the literal alone may be stored.
        Returns:
        true iff this is in conjunctive normal form.

      • isClausalNormalForm

        public abstract boolean isClausalNormalForm()
        Returns true iff this is in clausal normal form. This is a more narrow case of conjunctive normal form. Specifically, redundant nodes may not be omitted. In other words, this must be a conjunction of clauses. Each clause must in turn contain nothing but a positive amount of literals.
        Returns:
        true iff this is in clausal normal form

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String[] symbols)
        Returns a string representation of this node. The symbols for logical connectors, e.g. And, are given as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        symbols - the symbols for logical connectors
        Returns:
        a string representing this node
        See Also:
        (default), NodeWriter.logicalSymbols, NodeWriter.textualSymbols

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getContainedFeatures()

        Returns:

      • getAssignments

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean>> getAssignments()

        Returns all possible truth value assignments for all variables in this node.

        Let n denote the amount of literals in this node. Then this method will return exactly 2n assignments. Each assignment in turn contains exactly n entries (1 for each variable).

        Returns:
        all possible truth value assignments; not null

      • getSatisfyingAssignments

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean>> getSatisfyingAssignments()
        Returns all truth value assignments for which this node evaluates to true.
        Returns:
        all satisfying truth value assignments; not null

      • getContradictingAssignments

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Map<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Boolean>> getContradictingAssignments()
        Returns all truth value assignments for which this node evaluates to false.
        Returns:
        all contradicting truth value assignments; not null
